body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** v9.2.63-1 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-2159/folder/13176890/41237391/1035954283 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** N/A **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** iPhone 14 / iOS 26.1 **App Component:** User Settings ## Action Performed: 1. User has logged in Hybrid app with Expensifail account 2. Navigate to Troubleshoot in account settings 3. Tap on the Switch to Expensify Classic 4. Tap on the Hamburger menu and select Settings 5. Tap on Connected Cards 6. Tap on the Add to Apple/Google Wallet button 7. Tap on the Turn it on button ## Expected Result: The app goes to the 2FA flow ## Actual Result: The app crashes ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/43d3e7bd-0283-4258-aec9-acdc3e0f8f23 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.63-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Y **Reproducible in production?:** Unable to validate in Prod **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/73748 **Issue reported by:** Applause - Internal Team ## Action Performed: 1. Sign in to ND 2. Create a manual expense in the workspace chat 2. Enable Debug mode 3. Open expense details, click the header, then Debug 4. Scroll down to the constant fields, observe the "type" row - it shows "expense" 5. Add a distance expense to the report 6. Repeat steps 3-4 with any expense in the report - type row shows "chat" now ## Expected Result: "type" row shows "expense" for the expenses in the report ## Actual Result: "type" row shows "chat" for the expenses in the report, when there are more than one expense ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop

Go to https://staging.new.expensify.com/home 2. Go to Reports 3. Enter status: 4. Note suggestions shows status: (shown incorrectly) 5. Tap on it 6. Note no response as it musnt be shown in suggestions 7. Enter has: or group-by: 8. Open app 2. Navigate to any chat 3. Perform swipe-back gesture ## Expected Result: When performing the swipe-back gesture in Safari on iPhone, the previous screen should not appear. Navigation to the previous screen occurs smoothly, without flickering or momentary display of previous content ## Actual Result: When performing the swipe-back gesture in Safari on iPhone, the previous screen briefly flickers upon returning. This occurs on any screen of the app ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [x] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop
